item.title: Working with hugo
item.description: Setup Hugo blog This post will give an intro how to get started editing a Hugo Site. If you have not already Hugo setup, go to my previous post found here Run Hugo locally Go to your blog directory, where the content is and run: hugo server Add content (a new post) To add a new post, run: hugo new posts/intro-to-java-17.md This will create a file intro-to-java-17.md in your post directory, having a menu.

item.title: Create and host a blog using Hugo
item.description: Prerequisites: Some knowledge about GitHub is good. Since this is my first post in this blog, it will be about how to create and host a blog using Hugo and GitHub. I decided to use Hugo which is a static site generator that makes it easy to generate new pages/blog posts. Hugo can be cloned from GitHub and easily run at your local machine to start with. To have your site deployed on a static hosting service like Netlify or GitHub Pages.
